titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 28

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 20 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 28; Qurʾānic Text: Q 5:107-6:7; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 263 x 180mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragment Marcel 27 (NLR) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 28
20 fol. 180×263 mm (1.46). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color with traces of polishing. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation:
I: F1H;
II: H2F H3F H4F S H5F S F6H / F7H S F8H S F9H S F10H;
III: H11F H12F S H13F S H14F S H15F / F16H F17H S F18H S F19H S F20H (fol. 11 and 20, originally a bifolium, have been separated, fol. 11 glued to the previous quire).
Text layout: 80×160 mm (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. . Script: D III. Diacritics: diagonal dashes. Vocalization: red and blue round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins in gold and colors (type 4.A.II) with the inscribed word خمس; for groups of ten verses – medallions on the margins (type 3.D.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (ماية عشر – fol. 2v, ماية عشرون – fol. 14r), and accompanied with small medallions (type 4.A.II) marking the actual border of the verses in the text .
Title of surah 6 (الانعام ماية و ستون و سبع) is written in gold and accompanied with a large palmetto on the margin drawn in gold, red and blue paint (fol. 16r).
Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals; fol. 1–4 have foliation in pencil.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold of the second quire; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).
Defects: minor stains on two last sheets; parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink on fol. 20; minor peeling off of ink in the flesh side of some sheets.
Old accession numbers: B. 6 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–15v. Surah 5, verses 106(107) – 120(120)*. Incipit: [يَقوما]نِ مقامتُهما.
Fol. 16r–20v. Surah 6, verses 1(1) – 7(7). Explicit: لَقالَ الذ[ين كفروا] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 27 (NLR)"
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
